main event: An unidentified flying object was spotted over Dietrich, Idaho on February 3, 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as larger and faster than four jets flying over at the time., The object was circular in shape and silvery in color with no visible means of propulsion., The duration of the sighting was approximately 15 seconds., The object was stationary for 15 minutes before accelerating and climbing out of sight., Witnesses reported the object was approximately 1/3 the size of a full moon.
sighted object: one unidentified flying object, circular and silvery in color
witness description: a chief observer, two farmers, and a supervisor, all residing in Dietrich, Idaho
